SENT.plain: Pseudoaneurysms of the ascending aorta after the original inclusion/wrap technique of the Bentall procedure present a difficult surgical management problem and are associated with substantial morbidity and mortality
Patients with Marfan syndrome frequently develop aneurysms and dissections that involve multiple aortic segments
We present the case of a Marfan patient who successfully underwent repair of a giant ascending aortic pseudoaneurysm and concomitant repair of an abdominal aortic aneurysm
An aggressive surgical strategy followed by life-long cardiovascular monitoring is warranted in order to prolong the survival of these patients
